ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The completion of my senior thesis in partial fulfillment of the requirements for the BS degree of MB&B
I learned how to conduct a literature review and identify an area of promising future research, and then turn this into a senior paper.
I gained a significant amount of detailed knowledge regarding my chosen subfield, and additionally gained experience with compiling this research in the style of a review article.
I learned how to write a literature review and do in-depth research on a topic I was tangental familiar with.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course is generally self-directed, which I had no problems with. I appreciated that there were mandatory check-ins to keep students accountable and ensure that they do not cram their thesis in an unhealthy amount of time.

This course could use more engagement from the instructor throughout the semester. It felt like we had great meetings early in the semester and she offered to hold study halls, but throughout the semester we never really interacted to talk about the paper progress.

A strength of this course is that it has some structure to it beyond simply producing a thesis at the end of the semester, which helps keep students on track in terms of the pacing. It could potentially be improved by adding some kind of regular office hours, one every week or two, for students to ask any course-related questions they may have.

Could maybe have a weekly meeting/study hall to help students stay on track. Otherwise, feedback was great, instructor was attentive to emails/requests, and the course was very intellectually fulfilling.
Prof. Schilling was a great resource! However, I wished that the class had met more to work together.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. I really enjoyed writing my senior thesis with Prof. Schilling as a director for the thesis. I think she is very fair and gives good insight into improving scientific writing.
Yes, if you need to do it for the major.

I would definitely recommend this course! In my opinion, there's really no better way to learn about a field of interest than devoting a semester towards reading the primary literature and collating this information into an organized narrative. The thesis project is manageable and, as long as you choose a field of interest, it's highly enjoyable as well!
You gotta do what you gotta do.
I thought it was great practice for someone who wants to pursue a PhD.
